demographics.name: Robert Smith
demographics.supportServices: Chemo education and ostomy care resources provided, if applicable.

diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Change in bowel habits and rectal bleeding.
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Laparoscopic sigmoid colectomy with en bloc removal of regional lymph nodes performed on 03/10/2025.

treatmentPlan.modality: Adjuvant Chemotherapy followed by Adjuvant External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV_Pelvis targeting the primary tumor bed and regional lymph nodes.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in Vac-Lok bag with knee and ankle immobilization. Full bladder / empty rectum protocol followed. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT simulation for adjuvant pelvic radiation therapy post-chemotherapy.

dosimetry.constraints: Fem Head Max < 45 Gy; Bladder V45Gy < 30%; Bowel Max < 50 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Adjuvant pelvic RT post-chemo for Stage IIIB colon ca. Note: RT not standard per NCCN for this indication but proceeding per MD order.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily kV imaging for setup verification.
fractions.sideEffects: No acute side effects reported after first fraction.

imagingAndReports.summary: Adenocarcinoma of the Sigmoid Colon, Stage IIIB (T3, N2a, M0).

reportDetails.diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma of the Sigmoid Colon, Stage IIIB (T3, N2a, M0)
reportDetails.lymphNodes: 15 regional lymph nodes examined, 5 positive for metastatic carcinoma.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Susan Brown
progressNotes.summary: Post-operative visit - Recovering well from sigmoid colectomy. Final path shows T3N2a disease. Refer to Medical and Radiation Oncology for adjuvant therapy consideration.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant (post-operative) therapy to reduce the risk of cancer recurrence.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute radiation side effects: Diarrhea, fatigue, bladder irritation (frequency/urgency), and skin reaction in the treatment area. Side effects from chemotherapy reviewed by Med Onc.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Following a low-residue diet to help manage diarrhea. Importance of hydration. Reporting uncontrolled GI symptoms or significant skin breakdown.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, report side effects.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use supportive medications for diarrhea as instructed.

cptCharges.description: Radiation treatment delivery, single treatment area, complex
